conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D. Predict which container (E, F or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Container A is a mint/teal block at the top left.
Container B is an orange block, second from left.
Container C is a yellow block, middle.
Container D is a pink block, far right.
Container E is a red house-shaped container on the bottom left.
Container F is a gray house-shaped container.
Container G is a mint/teal and orange house-shaped container.

premise: Liquid drops straight down from A.
conclusion: Liquid from A first encounters a gray baffle angled diagonally.

premise: Liquid from A encounters a gray baffle angled diagonally.
conclusion: Liquid would slide along this gray baffle toward the right.

premise: Liquid from A slides along the gray baffle.
conclusion: Next, it would encounter a green baffle also angled diagonally.

premise: Liquid from A encounters a green baffle.
conclusion: Liquid would redirect along the green baffle, moving toward the left.

premise: Liquid from A redirects along the green baffle.
conclusion: Following this path downward leads to container E.

premise: Liquid drops straight down from B.
conclusion: Liquid would encounter the gray baffle.

premise: Liquid from B encounters the gray baffle.

premise: Liquid from B moves rightward along the gray baffle.

premise: Liquid from B hits the light pink baffle.
conclusion: The light pink baffle would direct it downward and slightly right.

premise: Liquid from B is directed by the light pink baffle.
conclusion: This path leads toward container F.
